intro: Eriogonum clivosum, commonly known as the rock spirea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are small, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and upright. Eriogonum clivosum is adapted to dry environments and is often found in open, sunny areas with well-drained soil.
